_header: I shall you tell without leasing
Note: All these MSS are rolls. Texts vary, and sometimes incorporate sections of 4210; for others formerly listed under this item number, see 4274, 5107, 2623, 5211.
Bibliographic Ghosts:
Oxford, Bodleian Library Ashmole Rolls 40 (SC 8447): contains 2623, 4274 and 5211 only; Oxford, Bodleian Library Ashmole 8 (SC 8465A): contains 5746 only, though cited in edition Ashmole (1652)
XAshmole, Elias. Theatrum Chemicum Britannicum. London: J. Grimond, 1652, 375-9.
_description: The Emblematical Scroll, attributed to George Ripley, on preparing the Philosopher’s Stone — in groups of couplets describing illustrations

CamFitz276.First Lines:
I shall you telle wythout lessyngeWho and what is my
                    generachenOmo Ienie is my fatherAnd maguessya is my
                    mother…
CamFitz276.Last Lines:
…And make him all but oneLoo here is the phyllosyfeer
                    stone
CamFitz276.Note:
Nineteen couplets, beneath an illustration of ‘The sarpene of
                    arabi’; ‘I shall you tell without lessinge’ follows 5211.

PUL93.First Lines:
I shalle yew tell with ovt lessyngWho and what ys my
                    generasyon…
PUL93.Last Lines:
…And make them all bvt onloo here ys the philosoffor
                    stone
PUL93.Note:
19 couplets, written in four columns, alternating red and
                    black.

HunHM30313.First Lines:
I Shall Now tell without Leesingehou & what is My
                    Generation…
HunHM30313.Last Lines:
…And make them all thre but oneLoe here is the philosephers
                    Stone
HunHM30313.Note: 38 lines, fourth among four under this number.
